Hello everyone. I'm an almost-35 year old male samurai enthusiast. 
I'm int=
erested in everything Japanese in general, but in samurai 
history in parti=
cular. I watch chanbara movies, read Turnbull-
sensei's books, play orienta=
l role-playing games, that sort of things.

I was reading the "Specific nin=
ja misconceptions" page, like a good 
newbie, and having a good laugh out o=
f it - even if it's nothing 
really new to me, fortunately - when I stumble=
d upon this sentence:  

<<Even "history" books may not be legit--see "Secr=
ets of the 
Samurai", which is, quite honestly, a pile of pig feces.>>

(so=
urce: http://www.geocities.com/klancesegall/Ninja.html )

I own a copy of "=
Secrets of the Samurai" by Oscar Ratti and Adele 
Westbrook, which is, for =
what I seem to remember, a very informative 
and accurate book, packed full=
 of useful info. Maybe I'm ignoring or 
forgetting something? I would like =
to know exactly what's the problem 
with this text.

Thanks,

--
C E Z
